qas.question: What other name does the KInsey scale go by?
When was the KInsey scale first published?
Why was the KInsey scale developed?

answers.text: to combat the assumption at the time that people are either heterosexual or homosexual

qas.question: What did KInsey state as his reasoning for the scale?

answers.text: Recognizing that a large portion of population is not completely heterosexual or homosexual and people can experience both heterosexual and homosexual behavior

qas.question: Who else was featured in The sexual behavior of the human male?

context: The Kinsey scale, also called the <a0_0>Heterosexual-Homosexual Rating Scale<a0_0/>, was first published in Sexual Behavior in the Human Male (<a1_0>1948<a1_0/>) by Alfred Kinsey, <a4_0>Wardell Pomeroy, and Clyde Martin<a4_0/> and also featured in Sexual Behavior in the Human Female (1953). The scale was developed <a2_0>to combat the assumption at the time that people are either heterosexual or homosexual<a2_0/> and that these two types represent antitheses in the sexual world. <a3_0>Recognizing that a large portion of population is not completely heterosexual or homosexual and people can experience both heterosexual and homosexual behavior<a3_0/> and psychic responses, Kinsey et al., stated:
